content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Don Essig</origin><pubdate>20130615</pubdate><title>Salmonid Spawning</title><geoform>vector digital data</geoform><pubinfo><pubplace>Idaho DEQ</pubplace><publish>Idaho Department of Environmental Quality</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=809888200adb455fab8e6da9b2e11289</onlink><onlink>http://www.deq.idaho.gov/water-quality/surface-water/standards.aspx</onlink><onlink>http://adminrules.idaho.gov/rules/current/58/0102.pdf</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>In order for the state of Idaho to utilize temperature criteria to protect various stream uses, such as spawning, the state is required to designate when and where spawning may occur. While Idaho previously has some waters designated for salmonid spawning in its water quality standards, many other waters where salmonids may or do spawn remain undesignated. This data takes the Idaho 305(b) streams and determines which portions of them are possible salmonid spawning areas.</abstract><purpose>These data were generated using the Idaho 305(b) streams layer and plotting the StreamNet salmonid spawning run location data along those streams. In addition, based on best available documentation and a number of agency contributions of professional judgment and known surveying, these areas were attributed at the HUC12 level with known salmonid spawning and emergence dates down to the nearest week.</purpose><supplinf>http://mapcase.deq.idaho.gov/wq2012/help/Geography%20and%20Time%20of%20Salmonid%20Spawning%20Report%20Final.pdf</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20130615</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>20130615</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>None planned</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-117.483066</westbc><eastbc>-110.679735</eastbc><northbc>49.039054</northbc><southbc>41.954688</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>Salmonid Spawning.</themekt><themekey>305B</themekey><themekey>Trout</themekey><themekey>Idaho Water Quality Standards</themekey><themekey>303D</themekey><themekey>TMDLS</themekey><themekey>Temperature</themekey><themekey>Salmonid</themekey><themekey>Salmon</themekey><themekey>Chinook</themekey><themekey>Coho</themekey><themekey>Spawning</themekey><themekey>Emergence</themekey></theme><place><placekt>None</placekt><placekey>Idaho</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>Scale and exent of Data</useconst><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntorgp><cntorg>Idaho DEQ</cntorg><cntper>Don Essig</cntper></cntorgp><cntpos>Water Quality Standards Coordinator</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype><address>1410 North Hilton</address><city>Boise</city><state>Idaho</state><postal>83706</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>208 373-0119</cntvoice><cntemail>don.essig@deq.idaho.gov</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac><datacred>Don Essig, Idaho DEQ, Anchor QEA, StreamNet</datacred><native>Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1.3497</native></idinfo><dataqual><attracc><attraccr>Not Reported</attraccr></attracc><logic>Line Features, no topology</logic><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>+-167 Feet - USGS Mapping Standards for 1:100,000 Data</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><srcinfo><srcscale>0</srcscale><typesrc>None</typesrc></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>These data were generated using the Idaho 305(b) streams layer and plotting the StreamNet (Species) spawning run location data along those streams. In addition, based on best available documentation and a number of agency contributions of professional judgment and known surveying, these areas were attributed at the HUC12 level with known fall chinook spawning and emergence dates down to the nearest week.</procdesc><procdate>20130618</procdate><proccont><cntinfo><cntorgp><cntorg>Idaho DEQ</cntorg><cntper>Don Essig</cntper></cntorgp><cntpos>Water Quality Standards Coordinator</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype><address>1410 North
